intro: Sempervivum ingwersenii, commonly known as the Alpine houseleek, is a species of succulent plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit, with thick, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and sunny environments, thriving in well-drained soil. Sempervivum ingwersenii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
